Tour of the French Riviera from Monaco to Cannes, 21 April 2003

---Weather was 62-68 F, sunny, with a nice breeze from the sea---
---We are crossing the route taken by Napoléon Bonaparte in 1815 on his march from Elba to Grenoble. He came ashore near Cannes and marched towards Grasse next.---
---The beautiful yacht basin at Antibes, the largest basin on the French Riviera---

---The average time yachts are used is 3 DAYS/year! Doesn't that look like a typical yachtsman who has just moored his yacht?---
---Obie in front of the old ramparts protecting the old city---
---Entrance to the old city of Antibes where Picasso painted often. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to see the Picasso Museum- next time!---

---Moving to Sainte-Paul-de-Vence, another perched town---
---House where Picasso and Matisse often met.---
---Square shaded by enormous plane-trees, just beginning to bud anew after severe pruning---
